lang

Class Constant

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Number
      • lang.Constant
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Number>

    public class Constant
extends java.lang.Number
implements java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Number>
    Class to maintain exact accuracy when using repeating decimals, non-integer, or constants, by holding a numerator, denominator, and array of Roots.
    Author:
    Luke Senseney
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • numerator

      • denominator

        public long denominator
        The denominator of the number.

      • roots

        public java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Integer,Constant> roots
        A Map of roots in this constant. For each key value^(1/key) is multiplied into this constant.

      • ONE

        public static final Constant ONE
        Constant with a value of 1.

      • NEGATE

      • raise

        public void raise(Constant power)
        Raises this to power. Note: ignores roots in power. For expressions like 5^(5^(1/2)), use Term.
        Parameters:
